chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Sean A Hammel was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 160 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Telephonic Transcript Fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney's office. All costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
**Attend a Victim Impact Panel meeting as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  *No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sean A Hammel in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Thomas H. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT -160 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*D/L REVOCATION:   36 MONTHS
*IGNITION INTERLOCK :  36 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
____No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  to be forwarded to Waukesha Police Department)

TELEPHONIC SEARCH WARRANT FEE:  $10.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forwarded to Clerk of Courts)  

FINE:  $1,695.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Sean A Hammel in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Sean A Hammel in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr Hammel indicates he has retained private counsel. Defendant allowed a non collect call.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing at 01-14-2016 01:15 pm

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.

Defendant Sean A Hammel in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
